title: Ashkenazi Jews
summary: Ashkenazi Jews (/ˌæʃ-, ɑːʃkəˈnɑːzi/ ASH-, AHSH-kə-NAH-zee;[18] Hebrew: יְהוּדֵי אַשְׁכְּנַז‎, romanized: Yehudei Ashkenaz), also known as Ashkenazic Jews or by using the Hebrew plural suffix -im, Ashkenazim[lower-alpha 1] are a Jewish diaspora population who coalesced in the Holy Roman Empire around the end of the first millennium.[20]
